entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 018: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
018: SECURITY FIX: January 13, 2023   All architectures
A TCP packet with destination port 0 that matches a pf divert-to rule could crash the kernel.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 013: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
013: SECURITY FIX: January 13, 2023   All architectures
A TCP packet with destination port 0 that matches a pf divert-to rule could crash the kernel.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 017: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
017: RELIABILITY FIX: December 16, 2022   All architectures
Removing a domain can result in an out-of-bounds write in acme-client(8).
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 012: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
012: RELIABILITY FIX: December 16, 2022   All architectures
Removing a domain can result in an out-of-bounds write in acme-client(8).
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 016: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
016: RELIABILITY FIX: December 14, 2022   amd64 i386
TLB entries were not invalidated for all types of engine on 12th generation Intel graphics (Tiger Lake, Rocket Lake, Alder Lake).
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 015: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
015: SECURITY FIX: December 14, 2022   All architectures
In X11 server fix local privileges elevation and and remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions. This addresses CVE-2022-46340 CVE-2022-46341 CVE-2022-46342 CVE-2022-46343 CVE-2022-46344.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 011: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
011: RELIABILITY FIX: December 14, 2022   amd64 i386
TLB entries were not invalidated for all types of engine on 12th generation Intel graphics (Tiger Lake, Rocket Lake, Alder Lake).
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 010: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
010: RELIABILITY FIX: December 14, 2022   amd64
Fix booting vmd(8) guests from ramdisk with more than 4g of memory.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 009: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
009: SECURITY FIX: December 14, 2022   All architectures
In X11 server fix local privileges elevation and and remote code execution for ssh X forwarding sessions. This addresses CVE-2022-46340 CVE-2022-46341 CVE-2022-46342 CVE-2022-46343 CVE-2022-46344.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 014: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
014: SECURITY FIX: November 26, 2022   All architectures
A crafted TCP query from localhost could crash the unwind(8) daemon.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 008: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
008: RELIABILITY FIX: November 26, 2022   All architectures
Fix a assertion crash during pfsync state update.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 007: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
007: SECURITY FIX: November 26, 2022   All architectures
A crafted TCP query from localhost could crash the unwind(8) daemon.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 006: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
006: RELIABILITY FIX: November 26, 2022   amd64
Incorrect reference counting and locking caused a vmm(4) performance regression.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 013: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
013: SECURITY FIX: November 14, 2022   All architectures
CVE-2022-44638: An integer overflow in pixman may lead to an out-of-bounds write.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 005: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
005: SECURITY FIX: November 14, 2022   All architectures
CVE-2022-44638: An integer overflow in pixman may lead to an out-of-bounds write.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 012: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
012: SECURITY FIX: November 1, 2022   All architectures
In libexpat fix heap use-after-free vulnerability CVE-2022-43680.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 004: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
004: SECURITY FIX: November 1, 2022   All architectures
In libexpat fix heap use-after-free vulnerability CVE-2022-43680.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 003: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
003: RELIABILITY FIX: October 27, 2022   All architectures
Restore operation of Apple-specific Fn-key keyboard sequences.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 002: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
002: RELIABILITY FIX: October 24, 2022   All architectures
Unbreak ASN.1 indefinite length encoding.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.2, 001: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
001: SECURITY FIX: October 24, 2022   All architectures
Custom verification callbacks could cause the X.509 verifier to fail to store errors resulting from leaf certificate verification.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 026: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
026: SECURITY FIX: September 26, 2022   All architectures
In smtpd(8), possible use-after-free if TLS handshake fails for outbound connections.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.content:
011: SECURITY FIX: September 26, 2022   All architectures
In smtpd(8), possible use-after-free if TLS handshake fails for outbound connections.

In libexpat fix heap use-after-free vulnerability CVE-2022-40674.

entry.content:

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 024: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
024: SECURITY FIX: August 12, 2022   All architectures
A missing length check in zlib could lead to a heap buffer overflow.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.content:
009: SECURITY FIX: August 12, 2022   All architectures
A missing length check in zlib could lead to a heap buffer overflow.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 008: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
008: RELIABILITY FIX: August 2, 2022   All architectures
bgpd(8) could fail to invalidate nexthops and incorrectly leave them in the FIB or Adj-RIB-Out.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 023: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
023: RELIABILITY FIX: July 24, 2022   All architectures
cron(8) aborted due to strange poll timevals.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 022: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
022: SECURITY FIX: July 24, 2022   All architectures
Input validation failures in the X server request parsing code can lead to out of bounds memory accesses for authorized clients.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 007: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
007: RELIABILITY FIX: July 24, 2022   All architectures
cron(8) aborted due to strange poll timevals.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.content:
006: SECURITY FIX: July 24, 2022   All architectures
Input validation failures in the X server request parsing code can lead to out of bounds memory accesses for authorized clients.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 021: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
021: SECURITY FIX: May 16, 2022   All architectures
Malicious PPPoE packets could corrupt kernel memory.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 005: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
005: SECURITY FIX: May 16, 2022   All architectures
Malicious PPPoE packets could corrupt kernel memory.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 004: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
004: RELIABILITY FIX: May 16, 2022   All architectures
libcrypto would incorrectly decode certain ASN.1 objects.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 003: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
003: RELIABILITY FIX: May 16, 2022   All architectures
The kernel could crash due to a race in kqueue.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 002: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
002: RELIABILITY FIX: May 5, 2022   All architectures
When using IPsec, the kernel could crash.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.1, 001: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
001: RELIABILITY FIX: April 22, 2022   All architectures
Many wireless network drivers could not scan access points correctly.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.
Notice: Some users will have installed a broken version of the syspatch71-001_wifi.tgz file (which prevents future syspatch files from installing), and must manually perform the following step to force deletion of the old file, and then syspatch forward:
# sed -i /release/d /usr/sbin/syspatch && syspatch -R && syspatch

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 020: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
020: RELIABILITY FIX: April 11, 2022   All architectures
rpki-client(8) handled time zones incorrectly.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 019: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
019: SECURITY FIX: April 5, 2022   All architectures
Fix zlib vulnerability in PPP and IPComp compression.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 018: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
018: SECURITY FIX: April 1, 2022   All architectures
Memory corruption in zlib can lead to a crash.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 017: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
017: SECURITY FIX: March 22, 2022   All architectures
A malicious router advertisement could overflow heap memory in unprivileged slaacd process.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 016: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
016: SECURITY FIX: March 15, 2022   All architectures
A malicious certificate can cause an infinite loop.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 015: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
015: SECURITY FIX: February 24, 2022   All architectures
Fix five security issues in libexpat related to encoding, stack exhaustion, and integer overflow.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 014: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
014: SECURITY FIX: February 21, 2022   All architectures
More than 7 nameservers in an IPv6 router advertisement could crash slaacd.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 013: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
013: SECURITY FIX: February 2, 2022   All architectures
Fix two security issues in libexpat related to integer overflow.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 012: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
012: RELIABILITY FIX: February 2, 2022   amd64 i386
Userspace controlled code on GPU can access kernel memory on Intel gen 8 and later GPUs.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 011: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
011: SECURITY FIX: January 24, 2022   macppc
On PowerPC kernel memory is leaked to userland.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 010: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
010: RELIABILITY FIX: January 19, 2022   amd64
Intel-based vmm(4) hosts may have vm processes die due to host-side state corruption.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 009: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
009: SECURITY FIX: January 19, 2022   All architectures
Fix 8 security issues in libexpat, all related to fixed-size integer math (integer overflow and invalid shifts) near memory allocation.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 008: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
008: SECURITY FIX: December 16, 2021   All architectures
If multicast routing is used, kernel memory is leaked to userland.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 007: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
007: SECURITY FIX: December 14, 2021   All architectures
Multiple input validation failures in the X server request parsing code can lead to out of bounds memory accesses for authorized clients.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 006: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
006: SECURITY FIX: November 26, 2021   All architectures
In some situations the X.509 verifier would discard an error on an unverified certificate chain, resulting in an authentication bypass.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 005: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
005: RELIABILITY FIX: November 26, 2021   All architectures
An unprivileged user could crash the kernel by using UNIX-domain sockets in multiple threads.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 004: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
004: SECURITY FIX: November 9, 2021   All architectures
rpki-client(8) should handle CA misbehaviours as soft-errors.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 003: SECURITY FIX
entry.content:
003: SECURITY FIX: October 31, 2021   All architectures
The kernel could leak memory when closing unix sockets.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 002: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
002: RELIABILITY FIX: October 31, 2021   All architectures
Opening /dev/bpf too often could lead to resource exhaustion.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.

entry.title: OpenBSD 7.0, 001: RELIABILITY FIX
entry.content:
001: RELIABILITY FIX: October 31, 2021   All architectures
In certain configurations, nsd(8) can be crashed by a remote attacker.
A source code patch exists which remedies this problem.
